item.title: Saudi Arabia, Some OPEC Members Clash Over Oil-Production Quotas
item.description: OPEC and its allies meet Sunday in Vienna to decide on an output plan.

item.title: U.S. and China Trade Barbs as Warships Have Close Encounter in Taiwan Strait
item.description: Chinese defense minister casts the U.S. as a hegemonic power in a speech at a Singapore security conference.

item.title: Wall Street Hasn't Been This Bearish on S&P 500 Since 2007
item.description: Hedge funds and other speculators are betting the S&P 500 will decline, while also preparing for a rally in the tech-focused Nasdaq.

item.title: U.S. Firms Raise Corruption Concerns in Legal Battle Over Ukraine Grain Deal
item.description: American investors allege that a Ukrainian company defaulted on loans and that parts of the Kyiv government are blocking efforts to recover $130 million in assets.

item.title: Why the U.S. Remains Far From Recession
item.description: The pandemic’s aftereffects are fueling economic resilience despite rising interest rates.

item.title: iOS 17 Is Coming. Here's What iPhones, iPads and Apple Watches Are Missing.
item.description: What we hope Apple will announce on Monday at the Worldwide Developers Conference.

item.title: The Software Slyly Turning Us Into Bigger Tippers
item.description: Adjusting the user interface on tip screens can have a powerful influence on our generosity.

item.title: Biden Leans on Deal-Making Skills to Avoid Crises as Poll Numbers Remain Stalled
item.description: The president’s approval ratings show that voters give him little credit for bipartisan compromises as he runs for another term.

item.title: Bearish Bets Against S&P 500 Are Surging, Despite Love for Big Tech
item.description: Hedge funds and other speculative investors have built up a big bet that the S&P 500 will decline, marking their most bearish positioning since 2007.

item.title: 'There Were Fists Everywhere.' Violence Against Teachers Is on the Rise.
item.description: Assaults have ratcheted up since the return to in-person learning, adding to broader concerns about safety in schools.

item.title: Three-Way Train Crash in India Kills More Than 250: 'I Haven't Seen Anything So Horrific'
item.description: A three-way train crash in India killed at least 261 people and injured hundreds more, in one of the deadliest rail accidents in the country’s history.

item.title: Turkey's Erdogan Appoints New Cabinet, Signaling Economic Shift
item.description: The newly re-elected President Recep Tayyip Erdogan also made changes in the leadership of foreign policy and security.

item.title: Iowa Republican Gathering Features a Growing 2024 Field
item.description: Trump skipped the “Roast & Ride” event attended by DeSantis, Haley and other GOP hopefuls.

item.title: Democrats Hatch Plans to End 'Insanity' of Debt-Ceiling Fights
item.description: Some lawmakers are seeking legislation or action by President Biden to avoid the recurring high-stakes standoffs on Capitol Hill.

item.title: Tennessee Judge Says Law Targeting Drag Shows Is Unconstitutional
item.description: The Adult Entertainment Act is too “vague and substantially overbroad,” according to Trump-appointed federal judge.

item.title: With Biden's Signature, Debt-Ceiling Saga Is a Wrap
item.description: The president signed into law bipartisan legislation that suspends the $31.4 trillion debt ceiling, narrowly avoiding an unprecedented U.S. default.

item.title: Manchester City Wins the FA Cup and Closes In on Historic Trophy Sweep
item.description: The club downed its crosstown rival Manchester United, 2-1. It will have a chance to complete the treble on June 10 in the Champions League final against Inter Milan.

item.title: Sure, It's Stylish. But This Pool House Was Built to Withstand a Hurricane
item.description: The Coral Gable homeowners spent $750,000 to create a storm-proof structure that had multiple uses.
